DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the anatomic location in the lung.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of organs in the chest that supplies the body with oxygen, and removes carbon dioxide from the body._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Concepts.definition: A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lower Lobe of the Left Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lower Lobe of the Left Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The larger lobe of the left lung, situated below and behind the oblique fissure.

Concepts.longName: Lower Lobe of the Left Lung
Concepts.definition: The larger lobe of the left lung, situated below and behind the oblique fissure.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Upper Lobe of the Left Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Upper Lobe of the Left Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smaller lobe of the left lung, situated above and in front the oblique fissure, which includes the apex.

Concepts.longName: Upper Lobe of the Left Lung
Concepts.definition: The smaller lobe of the left lung, situated above and in front the oblique fissure, which includes the apex.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lower Lobe of the Right Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lower Lobe of the Right Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lobe of the right lung situated below the oblique fissure.

Concepts.longName: Lower Lobe of the Right Lung
Concepts.definition: The lobe of the right lung situated below the oblique fissure.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Middle Lobe of the Right Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Middle Lobe of the Right Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest lobe of the right lung, situated above the oblique fissure and below the horizontal fissure.

Concepts.longName: Middle Lobe of the Right Lung
Concepts.definition: The smallest lobe of the right lung, situated above the oblique fissure and below the horizontal fissure.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Upper Lobe of the Right Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Upper Lobe of the Right Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lobe of the right lung, situated above the horizontal fissure, which includes the apex.

Concepts.longName: Upper Lobe of the Right Lung
Concepts.definition: The lobe of the right lung, situated above the horizontal fissure, which includes the apex.
